attributes.description: Maximum allowable activation time from fire detection to suppression initiation.
attributes.name: activationTime

attributes.description: Operational temperature range ensuring efficacy of suppression agents and sensor stability.
attributes.name: operatingTemperatureRange

attributes.description: Level of redundancy in suppression controls to prevent single point failures during emergencies.
attributes.name: redundancyLevel

attributes.description: Reliability measured as mean time between failures (MTBF) for the fire suppression system.
attributes.name: MTBF

attributes.description: Energy and power backup specifications ensuring uninterrupted operation during emergencies.
attributes.name: powerBackup
attributes.value: Dual power supply with integrated battery backup

designScenario.description: The Fire Suppression System is engineered specifically to detect, control, and suppress onboard fires through rapid activation of suppression agents. The design integrates advanced sensors, a dedicated suppression control unit, and automated deployable suppression agents, ensuring that fire incidents are mitigated quickly to protect both structural integrity and passenger safety. This system is a critical component of the airplane's overall emergency response framework and complies with stringent aviation standards.
designScenario.name: Fire Suppression System

details.description: Automatically trigger suppression mechanisms upon confirmed fire detection via integrated sensor arrays.
Interface directly with aircraft control systems to override non-essential operations during a fire event.
Achieve suppression agent deployment within 3 seconds of fire confirmation.
Ensure rapid distribution of suppression agents for complete coverage of affected zones.
Maintain fail-safe operations with redundant control circuits and parallel agent distribution networks.
Incorporate isolation of faulty modules and continuous system diagnostics during an emergency.
Provide intuitive pilot and crew interfacing with real-time system status and suppression agent levels.
Enable remote diagnostics and firmware updates to ensure long term maintainability.

relationships.description: The Fire Suppression Control Unit aggregates input from the Fire Detection Interface to make timely suppression decisions.
The Fire Suppression Control Unit is composed of the Suppression Agent Distribution Module, ensuring a tightly integrated response.
The Emergency Override Interface depends on the Fire Suppression Control Unit to allow manual intervention and safe system shutdown.
The Power Backup System is composed of battery and dual power modules to guarantee continuous operation of the suppression system.
The Power Backup System is composed of battery and dual power modules to guarantee continuous operation of the suppression system.

systemComponents.description: Processes sensor inputs and controls the activation of suppression mechanisms upon fire detection.
systemComponents.name: Fire Suppression Control Unit

systemComponents.description: Monitors environmental conditions and detects fire signatures using advanced thermal and optical sensors.
systemComponents.name: Fire Detection Interface

subComponents.description: Infrared sensors calibrated to detect abnormal thermal patterns indicative of a fire.
subComponents.name: Infrared Sensor Array

subComponents.description: Optical sensors designed to verify flame presence, supporting redundant detection.
subComponents.name: Optical Flame Sensor

systemComponents.description: Deploys suppression agents such as inert gases or extinguishing chemicals through an array of nozzles.
systemComponents.name: Suppression Agent Distribution Module

subComponents.description: Nozzle array engineered for uniform distribution of suppression agents across the fire zone.
subComponents.name: Nozzle Array

subComponents.description: Storage tank housing the suppression agents, designed for high-pressure discharge.
subComponents.name: Agent Storage Tank

systemComponents.description: Provides an emergency manual override for pilots and crew to control or abort suppression actions.
systemComponents.name: Emergency Override Interface

subComponents.description: Touchscreen control panel with multilingual support for emergency intervention.
subComponents.name: Override Control Panel

systemComponents.description: Ensures uninterrupted operation of the suppression system via redundant power sources.
systemComponents.name: Power Backup System

subComponents.description: High-output battery module designed for emergency power surges.
subComponents.name: Battery Module

subComponents.description: Dual-input power converter for seamless transition between main and auxiliary power supplies.
subComponents.name: Dual Power Module

comments.body: This block represents the Fire Suppression System, responsible for detecting, controlling, and extinguishing fires within the aircraft.
